hero.title: About DamDoh
hero.subtitle: Connecting the global agricultural supply chain, one stakeholder at a time.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.p1: We envision a world where every agricultural stakeholder, from the smallest farmer to the largest retailer, is empowered with the data, connections, and tools they need to thrive.
vision.p2: DamDoh was founded on the belief that technology can bridge gaps, build trust, and create a more equitable and sustainable global food system.

challenge.title: The Challenge We're Solving
challenge.description: The agricultural supply chain is fragmented, inefficient, and often lacks the transparency needed for sustainable growth. Key challenges include:

list.knowledge: Fragmented knowledge and lack of access to best practices.
list.market: Limited market access for smallholder farmers.
list.quality: Inconsistent quality control and a lack of verifiable product data.
list.logistics: Inefficient logistics leading to post-harvest losses.
list.financial: Difficulty accessing finance and insurance for small-scale producers.
list.climate: Increasing pressure from climate change on traditional farming methods.
list.informal: Informal and relationship-based systems that can exclude new entrants.

solution.title: The DamDoh Solution
solution.description: We are building a comprehensive 'super app' that digitizes and connects the entire agricultural ecosystem through several key pillars:

p2p.title: People to People
p2p.content: Connecting farmers to other farmers to share knowledge and build community.

p2b.title: People to Business
p2b.content: Fostering direct, trusted relationships between producers and buyers.

p2e.title: People to Ecosystem
p2e.content: Giving individuals access to a whole ecosystem of services – finance, logistics, insurance, and more.

p2w.title: People to World
p2w.content: Opening global markets and opportunities for even the most remote producers through digital access and traceability.

commitment.title: Our Commitment to the Future
commitment.p1: We are committed to using technology for good, creating a platform that is not only profitable but also regenerative for our planet and empowering for its people.
commitment.p2: Every connection made, every piece of knowledge shared, and every transaction streamlined on DamDoh is a step toward a more resilient and equitable food future.

contactPage.title: Contact Us
contactPage.subtitle: We're here to help. Reach out to us through any of the channels below.

sendMessage.title: Send us a message
sendMessage.note: We strive to respond within 24 business hours.

careers.title: Careers at DamDoh
careers.subtitle: Join our mission to revolutionize the agricultural supply chain.

whyWorkWithUs.title: Why Work With Us?
whyWorkWithUs.intro: At DamDoh, we are a team of innovators, technologists, and agricultural experts passionate about making a tangible, global impact. We offer:
whyWorkWithUs.point1: A mission-driven and dynamic work environment.
whyWorkWithUs.point2: Opportunities for professional growth and learning.
whyWorkWithUs.point3: A culture of collaboration and transparency.
whyWorkWithUs.point4: The chance to work with cutting-edge tech like AI and blockchain.
whyWorkWithUs.point5: A commitment to sustainability and social impact.

job1.title: Senior Full-Stack Engineer (Next.js, Firebase)
job1.description: We are looking for an experienced full-stack engineer to lead the development of core features of our platform.

job2.title: Agronomy Content Specialist
job2.description: Help us build the world's most comprehensive knowledge base for sustainable farming practices.

job3.title: UX/UI Designer
job3.description: Design intuitive and accessible user experiences for a diverse and global user base.

noOpenings.title: No Current Openings
noOpenings.content1: We are always looking for talented individuals who are passionate about our mission. If you think you'd be a great fit for our team, please send your resume and cover letter to {emailLink}.

communityGuidelines.title: Community Guidelines
communityGuidelines.subtitle: Fostering a professional, trustworthy, and collaborative environment.
communityGuidelines.intro: Welcome to the DamDoh community! To ensure our platform remains a productive and safe space for all agricultural stakeholders, we ask that you adhere to the following guidelines:

respectful.title: Be Respectful and Professional
respectful.description: Engage in civil and constructive discussions. Disagreements are normal, but personal attacks, harassment, and hate speech are unacceptable.

authentic.title: Be Honest and Authentic
authentic.description: Represent yourself and your business accurately. Do not impersonate others or provide false information about your products, services, or certifications.

relevant.title: Stay Relevant
relevant.description: Contribute to discussions and listings in a manner that is relevant to the agricultural supply chain. Spam, scams, and irrelevant promotional content will be removed.

fairTrade.title: Honor Your Commitments
fairTrade.description: When you make an agreement on the platform, follow through. Building trust is essential to the success of our community.

sustainable.title: Promote Sustainability
sustainable.description: While not a strict requirement for all members, we encourage the sharing of knowledge and practices that promote environmental, economic, and social sustainability.

reporting.title: Reporting Violations
reporting.content: If you see content or behavior that violates these guidelines, please report it to our team at {emailLink}. We will review all reports and take appropriate action.

communityGuidelines.conclusion: By using DamDoh, you agree to these guidelines. We reserve the right to remove content and suspend accounts that violate these principles. Thanks for helping us build a great community!

industryNewsPage.title: Industry News & Insights
industryNewsPage.description: Stay informed on the latest trends, research, and policy changes affecting the global agricultural supply chain.

noNews.title: No News Yet
noNews.description: Check back later for the latest industry updates and reports.

news1.title: Global Coffee Prices Surge Amidst Climate Concerns in Key Growing Regions
news1.excerpt: Coffee arabica futures hit an 18-month high as drought in Brazil and unexpected frosts in Vietnam threaten global supply.

news2.title: EU Implements New 'Farm to Fork' Packaging Regulations
news2.excerpt: New regulations taking effect this quarter require all fresh produce imported into the European Union to use packaging made from at least 30% recycled materials.

news3.title: Study Shows Regenerative Agriculture Practices Can Sequester Up to 2 Tons of Carbon Per Hectare Annually
news3.excerpt: A decade-long study published in 'Nature Sustainability' provides compelling evidence that no-till farming and cover cropping significantly improve soil carbon levels.

knfOptions.placeholder: e.g., Sweet potato tips, bamboo shoots

knfOptions.label: Indigenous Microorganisms (IMO)
knfOptions.placeholder: e.g., Cooked rice, local forest soil

recipeData.name: Fermented Plant Juice (FPJ)
recipeData.description: A potent growth enhancer made from the fermented sap of fast-growing plants. Rich in enzymes and microorganisms.
ingredients: 1kg of fast-growing plant parts (e.g., sweet potato tips, bamboo shoots)
steps: Collect plant material before sunrise when most potent. Do not wash.
Add an equal weight of brown sugar and mix well.
Pack tightly into a breathable container, filling to about 2/3 capacity.
Cover with a cloth, store in a cool, dark place for approx. 7 days.
recipeData.usage: Dilution rate: 1:500 to 1:1000 with water. Applied as foliar spray or soil drench.

recipeData.name: Fish Amino Acid (FAA)
recipeData.description: A nitrogen-rich fertilizer made from fermented fish parts, excellent for vegetative growth.
steps: Chop the fish parts into small pieces.
Layer the fish parts and brown sugar in a container (2/3 full).
Cover and let ferment in a cool, dark place for at least 3-6 months.
recipeData.usage: Dilution rate: 1:1000 with water. Primarily used as a soil drench.

recipeData.name: Water-Soluble Calcium (WCA)
recipeData.description: Provides essential calcium for fruiting and flowering stages.
steps: Roast eggshells until lightly browned, then grind into a powder.
Place eggshell powder in a jar.
Pour vinegar over the powder (10 parts vinegar to 1 part eggshell by volume).
Bubbles will form. It is ready when bubbling stops (~7-10 days).
recipeData.usage: Dilution rate: 1:1000 with water. Use as a foliar spray during flowering/fruiting.
